references.paper_title: Efficient selectivity and backup operators in monte-carlo tree search
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the understanding of Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS), a core algorithm in AlphaZero and the subject of the current paper.
This paper introduces the bandit-based approach in MCTS, crucial for its efficiency and effectiveness in decision-making problems.

references.paper_title: A general reinforcement learning algorithm that masters chess, shogi, and go through self-play
references.reason: AlphaZero, the subject of significant discussion in this paper, is based on this work which demonstrates the power of self-play reinforcement learning in mastering complex games.
KataGo, used as a benchmark in this paper, is based on this work which focuses on efficient implementation of AlphaZero for the game of Go.
This paper explores parallel MCTS algorithms, a subject related to the main focus of this paper on improving AlphaZero training efficiency.
